physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It features two Chinese opera singers on stage. They are elaborately dressed in opera costumes
 on either side of a draped textile. The woman on the left is holding a fan in her hand. The photograph is slightly faded
 especially along the right side. There are no tears or folds seen.

subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:This carte-de-visite format photograph of two Chinese opera actors was taken by John Thomson
 who arrived in Singapore in 1862 and established a studio at Beach Road on 16 June that year. Thomson would later travel to photograph in Siam and China before embarking on a series on street life in London.\r\n

metadata.title_text: Chinese opera actors on stage Photograph of Chinese opera actors on stage
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features two Chinese opera singers on stage. They are elaborately dressed in opera costumes, on either side of a draped textile. The woman on the left is holding a fan in her hand. The photograph is slightly faded, especially along the right side. There are no tears or folds seen.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Carte de visite photographs Photographs Chinese operas Ethnic costume
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This carte-de-visite format photograph of two Chinese opera actors was taken by John Thomson, who arrived in Singapore in 1862 and established a studio at Beach Road on 16 June that year. Thomson would later travel to photograph in Siam and China before embarking on a series on street life in London.
